2. "Lateral cell membranes" - These are the membranes that separate adjacent cells in a tissue.
3. "Plasma membranes" - These are the outermost membranes of cells that separate the cell from the external environment.
4. "Intercellular and intracellular edema" - Edema refers to the accumulation of fluid within cells or between cells, which can be a sign of disease.
5. "Disintegration of the desmosomes and hemidesmosomes" - Desmosomes and hemidesmosomes are structures that help hold cells together and provide mechanical strength to the tissue. Their disintegration can lead to the breakdown of tissue structure and function.
6. "Progressive degeneration and detachment of the epithelial cells" - This refers to the gradual deterioration and separation of epithelial cells, which can be a sign of disease.
7. "Exposure and splitting of the basal membrane" - The basal membrane is a thin layer of extracellular material that separates the epithelial cells from the underlying tissue. Exposure and splitting of the basal membrane can be a sign of disease.

* Breaks in cell membranes
* Edema (intercellular and intracellular)
* Disintegration of desmosomes and hemidesmosomes
* Progressive degeneration and detachment of epithelial cells
* Exposure and splitting of the basal membrane.
